84: Tosca used a knife to kill Scarpia.Context: The Carnegie Museum of Natural History in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, was founded by Andrew Carnegie in 1896. The museum is home to a diverse collection of artifacts, including the first known dinosaur eggs in the Western Hemisphere. The museum also has a significant collection of fossils, including the largest T. rex skull ever discovered. The museum was designed by architects Brinton C. Davis and Henry Hornbostel. The Carnegie Museum of Natural History is a part of the Carnegie Museums of Pittsburgh.
